Nonzero divisors have valuation greater than zero.

type:
∀ {R : Type u_1} [inst : CommRing R] [inst_1 : IsDomain R] [inst_2 : IsDedekindDomain R]
  (v : IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum R) (x : ↥(nonZeroDivisors R)),
  0 < IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum.intValuationDef v ↑x
name: IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum.int_valuation_zero_le
docString: Nonzero divisors have valuation greater than zero.

For all natural numbers $n$, $1$ is a proper divisor of $n$ if and only if $n$ is a positive integer.

type: ∀ {n : ℕ}, 1 ∈ n.properDivisors ↔ 1 < n
name: Nat.one_mem_properDivisors_iff_one_lt
docString: For all natural numbers $n$, $1$ is a proper divisor of $n$ if and only if $n$ is a positive integer.

The theorem `Real.pi_div_two_pos` asserts that the number Pi divided by 2 is greater than zero. In other words, it establishes the positivity of half of Pi, a basic and important property of this mathematical constant in the field of real numbers.

type: 0 < Real.pi / 2
name: Real.pi_div_two_pos
docString: The theorem `Real.pi_div_two_pos` asserts that the number Pi divided by 2 is greater than zero. In other words, it establishes the positivity of half of Pi, a basic and important property of this mathematical constant in the field of real numbers.

The absolute value is positive definitive

type:
∀ {S : Type u_1} [inst : OrderedSemiring S] {R : Type u_2} [inst_1 : Semiring R] {f : R → S} [self : IsAbsoluteValue f]
  {x : R}, f x = 0 ↔ x = 0
name: IsAbsoluteValue.abv_eq_zero'
docString: The absolute value is positive definitive

For any natural number n and integer z, n divides z if and only if n divides the absolute value of z.

type: ∀ {n : ℕ} {z : ℤ}, ↑n ∣ z ↔ n ∣ z.natAbs
name: Int.ofNat_dvd_left
docString: For any natural number n and integer z, n divides z if and only if n divides the absolute value of z.

This theorem, `Nat.pos_of_dvd_of_pos`, states that for any two natural numbers `m` and `n`, if `m` divides `n` and `n` is greater than 0, then `m` is also greater than 0. In terms of number theory, it asserts that a non-zero number cannot be divided by zero, since division by zero is undefined.

name: Nat.pos_of_dvd_of_pos
docString: This theorem, `Nat.pos_of_dvd_of_pos`, states that for any two natural numbers `m` and `n`, if `m` divides `n` and `n` is greater than 0, then `m` is also greater than 0. In terms of number theory, it asserts that a non-zero number cannot be divided by zero, since division by zero is undefined.

Greatest common divisor of a finite set

type:
{α : Type u_1} →
  {β : Type u_2} → [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] → [inst : NormalizedGCDMonoid α] → Finset β → (β → α) → α
name: Finset.gcd
docString: Greatest common divisor of a finite set

The absolute value is nonnegative

type:
∀ {R : Type u_1} {S : Type u_2} [inst : Semiring R] [inst_1 : OrderedSemiring S] (self : AbsoluteValue R S) (x : R),
  0 ≤ MulHom.toFun self.toMulHom x
name: AbsoluteValue.nonneg'
docString: The absolute value is nonnegative

If a polynomial of degree 2 is always nonnegative, then its discriminant is nonpositive

type: ∀ {K : Type u_1} [inst : LinearOrderedField K] {a b c : K}, (∀ (x : K), 0 ≤ a * x * x + b * x + c) → discrim a b c ≤ 0
name: discrim_le_zero
docString: If a polynomial of degree 2 is always nonnegative, then its discriminant is nonpositive

The `p`-adic norm is nonnegative.

type: ∀ {p : ℕ} (q : ℚ), 0 ≤ padicNorm p q
name: padicNorm.nonneg
docString: The `p`-adic norm is nonnegative.

Nonzero divisors have nonzero valuation.

type:
∀ {R : Type u_1} [inst : CommRing R] [inst_1 : IsDomain R] [inst_2 : IsDedekindDomain R]
  (v : IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum R) (x : ↥(nonZeroDivisors R)),
  IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum.intValuationDef v ↑x ≠ 0
name: IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum.int_valuation_ne_zero'
docString: Nonzero divisors have nonzero valuation.

If an integer with larger absolute value divides an integer, it is
zero.

type: ∀ {a b : ℤ}, a ∣ b → Int.natAbs b < Int.natAbs a → b = 0
name: Int.eq_zero_of_dvd_of_natAbs_lt_natAbs
docString:
If an integer with larger absolute value divides an integer, it is
zero.

The `p`-adic norm is an absolute value: positive-definite and multiplicative, satisfying the
triangle inequality.

type: ∀ {p : ℕ} [hp : Fact (Nat.Prime p)], IsAbsoluteValue (padicNorm p)
name: padicNorm.instIsAbsoluteValueRatInstOrderedSemiringRatSemiringPadicNorm
docString:
The `p`-adic norm is an absolute value: positive-definite and multiplicative, satisfying the
triangle inequality.

Multiplication by positive integers is injective

type: ∀ {R : Type u_1} [inst : Semiring R] [self : BinomialRing R] (n : ℕ), n ≠ 0 → Function.Injective fun x => n • x
name: BinomialRing.nsmul_right_injective
docString: Multiplication by positive integers is injective

The positive semidefinite square root of a positive semidefinite matrix

type:
{n : Type u_2} →
  {𝕜 : Type u_4} →
    [inst : Fintype n] →
      [inst_1 : IsROrC 𝕜] → [inst_2 : DecidableEq n] → {A : Matrix n n 𝕜} → Matrix.PosSemidef A → Matrix n n 𝕜
name: Matrix.PosSemidef.sqrt
docString: The positive semidefinite square root of a positive semidefinite matrix

The exponential pdf is positive for all positive reals

type: ∀ {x r : ℝ}, 0 < r → 0 < x → 0 < ProbabilityTheory.exponentialPDFReal r x
name: ProbabilityTheory.exponentialPDFReal_pos
docString: The exponential pdf is positive for all positive reals

The inner product is positive definite.

type:
∀ {𝕜 : Type u_4} {F : Type u_5} [inst : IsROrC 𝕜] [inst_1 : AddCommGroup F] [inst_2 : Module 𝕜 F]
  (self : InnerProductSpace.Core 𝕜 F) (x : F), ⟪x, x⟫_𝕜 = 0 → x = 0
name: InnerProductSpace.Core.definite
docString: The inner product is positive definite.

`π` considered as a nonnegative real.

type: NNReal
name: NNReal.pi
docString: `π` considered as a nonnegative real.

`n : ℕ` is perfect if and only the sum of the proper divisors of `n` is `n` and `n`
is positive.

type: ℕ → Prop
name: Nat.Perfect
docString:
`n : ℕ` is perfect if and only the sum of the proper divisors of `n` is `n` and `n`
is positive.

The gamma pdf is positive for all positive reals

type: ∀ {x a r : ℝ}, 0 < a → 0 < r → 0 < x → 0 < ProbabilityTheory.gammaPDFReal a r x
name: ProbabilityTheory.gammaPDFReal_pos
docString: The gamma pdf is positive for all positive reals

The `p`-adic norm respects division.

type: ∀ {p : ℕ} [hp : Fact (Nat.Prime p)] (q r : ℚ), padicNorm p (q / r) = padicNorm p q / padicNorm p r
name: padicNorm.div
docString: The `p`-adic norm respects division.

The conjugate transpose of a matrix mulitplied by the matrix is positive semidefinite

type:
∀ {m : Type u_1} {n : Type u_2} {R : Type u_3} [inst : Fintype m] [inst_1 : Fintype n] [inst_2 : CommRing R]
  [inst_3 : PartialOrder R] [inst_4 : StarOrderedRing R] (A : Matrix m n R),
  Matrix.PosSemidef (Matrix.conjTranspose A * A)
name: Matrix.posSemidef_conjTranspose_mul_self
docString: The conjugate transpose of a matrix mulitplied by the matrix is positive semidefinite

The quotient norm is nonnegative.

type: ∀ {M : Type u_1} [inst : SeminormedAddCommGroup M] (S : AddSubgroup M) (m : M), 0 ≤ ‖(QuotientAddGroup.mk' S) m‖
name: norm_mk_nonneg
docString: The quotient norm is nonnegative.
